conversation.message: Hello School_B Admissions, I’m Student_A. School_B is my first-choice school, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. I would like to formally apply and would happily accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_B is my top true choice. All schools rank me highest priority, so applying immediately to my first choice maximizes my chance to lock in the best possible outcome before other students approach it.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We’re excited about the possibility of you joining our community.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Student_A is the top-ranked student on School_B's true priority list. They have applied in round 1 and explicitly stated School_B is their first choice and they would accept an offer. With quota 1 and no other applicants in the inbox this round, accepting immediately secures the best possible match for School_B and avoids any risk of losing Student_A to another school in subsequent rounds.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_B and I’m formally applying to School_A as my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join and would immediately accept an offer. I believe I would contribute positively to the academic environment and school community through consistent effort and active participation. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_A, and all schools share the same priority order with Student_A ranked above me. To maximize my chance at my highest-preferred outcome, I should apply immediately to School_A and clearly signal strong commitment and fit, rather than spending a round talking or applying to a lower choice.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for naming School_A as your first choice. We appreciate your motivation and the contributions you describe.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_A. Please confirm your intention to enroll so we can finalize next steps.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and only Student_B has applied this round. On our true priority list, Student_A is ranked higher than Student_B, but Student_A’s first choice is School_B, so they may not apply to us soon (or at all). Student_B ranks School_A as their first choice and is applying now, providing a secure match. With no other applications in the inbox, accepting Student_B maximizes the chance of filling our seat with a high-priority acceptable student rather than risking ending unmatched while waiting for Student_A.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions Committee, I’m Student_D. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll if offered a seat. So I should apply immediately and clearly signal strong commitment to improve my chances in case the school has any discretion in selecting among applicants.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for expressing such strong interest in School_D. We appreciate your commitment and would be glad to welcome you to our community. We are pleased to offer you admission—congratulations.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority list ranks Student_D fourth, and higher-ranked students (A, B, C) may become available. However, Student_D is applying now and states School_D is first choice, so accepting secures a committed match immediately. Given the market, Student_A prefers School_B first, Student_B prefers School_A first, Student_C prefers School_C first; they are unlikely to apply to School_D early, and waiting risks ending unmatched. With only one applicant in the inbox and no current match, accepting Student_D is a safe way to fill the seat with an acceptable student on our list.

conversation.message: Hello School_E Admissions Committee, I’m Student_E and School_E is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly value the programs and school environment you offer, and I’m ready to commit if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.

With all schools sharing the same priority order (A > B > C > D > E), I have the lowest priority everywhere, so waiting or talking risks losing my best option without improving my standing. A direct early application to School_E maximizes my chance to secure my highest true preference before capacity is taken.

conversation.message: Thank you for your application and for sharing that School_E is your first choice. After reviewing our current admissions priorities and available seat, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest in School_E and wish you the best in the process.

With quota 1, accepting Student_E now would lock in the lowest-ranked option and foreclose any chance to match with a higher-priority student. Therefore, reject now to preserve capacity and wait for potentially higher-ranked applicants in later rounds.

conversation.message:
